Reviews.Title: DETAILED COMPARISON OF SONY TX10 to Panasonic TS3
Reviews.Author: SammiMur
Reviews.Content: First, some background on what I was looking for:  I'm a casual photographer.  I wanted a waterproof camera which would produce high-quality photos in all settings (indoor, outdoor, and underwater.  My intention was to completely replace my 7.2MP Sony DSC-W7, which I LOVE.  I wanted to add the underwater feature without compromising on other features.  I did not want to spend more than about $400 for everything (camera, two 8GB memory cards (Class 10), two extra batteries with charger, and float strap.  This left me with about $340 max to spend on the camera itself.  I do NOT know a lot about photography.  Terms like "ISO" and "white balance" are foreign to me.  I like to use pre-programmed scene modes and auto features.  I enjoy digital scrapbooking and I frequently zoom and crop.  It takes a very high quality photo to crop out/enlarge a small figure without too much distortion.I began my search online and spent about 6 hours researching the cameras in my price range.  The cameras I focused on most were the Canon D10, Sony TX10, Panasonic TS3 (sometimes referred to as FT3), Olympus TG-810, Olympus Tough 8010, Fujifilm XP30, and Pentax WG-1.I eliminated most of these options rather quickly based on their reviews, overall ratings, and the quality of photos that I reviewed.  I narrowed my focus to the Canon D10, the Sony TX10, and the Panasonic TS3.I wanted to love the Canon D10, since it seems to be the overwhelming fan favorite, but I ultimately decided that it wasn't going to be a good fit for me.  The price of the D10 is similar to the Sony and the Panasonic, but it's a 2.5 year old model which doesn't have HD video.  The photo quality seemed about equivalent to the other two, so I decided to only focus on the two models with HD video.I would have been completely sold on the Sony, since I've used only Sony cameras most of my adult life and I've never been disappointed in one; however, there were some notable deficiencies which most reviewers found with this model (detailed below), so I was a bit hesitant to take the plunge.  The Sony was also priced near the top of my budget ($329), whereas the Panasonic was only $275 at Amazon.com.  The Panasonic reviews seemed to all be very positive, with the only significantly commonly-noted problem being lower quality indoor photos.  However, all of the indoor, outdoor, and underwater photos that I reviewed online looked very good.I decided to take a chance on the Panasonic TS3 and I really, really, wanted to fall in love with it.  I ordered it from Amazon and they delivered it the next day.  I wasn't blown away by this camera.  The outdoor photos were good.  The video was very good.  The underwater photos (taken in my large fish tank) were very good.  The indoor photos were POOR.  I decided to order the Sony TX10, hoping that I'd see better results.  I ordered it from Amazon at 9pm that night and it was delivered at 1:00pm the next day (gotta love Amazon!).  The photo quality of the Sony camera is outstanding.  I'll be keeping the Sony TX10!!!  For some people, however, the Panasonic might be the better choice.First, I'll provide my overall recommendations, then I'll add in all of the detail:BUY THE SONY TX10 IF:You value the quality of the photos/video above all else.You like touch screen devices.You don't plan to dive lower than 16 feet.You don't care if you can't adjust your settings (other than zoom) underwater.You want a VERY small camera.You always use a wrist strap.BUY THE PANASONIC TS3 IF:You can live with grainy indoor photos.You don't typically enlarge your photos to 100% (because they will be distorted).You want a camera with GPS.You plan to dive deeper than 16 feet.You want a larger (but not too big) camera.You're looking for a less expensive option.NOW FOR MY DETAILED COMMENTS ON BOTH MODELS:PRICE - The Sony is +/- $50 more expensive than the Panasonic.SIZE - The Sony is significantly smaller and lighter than the Panasonic.  I don't think one is better than the other, per se.  It's a matter of personal preference.  The Sony will fit in most pockets.  The Panasonic probably wouldn't.RUGGEDNESS - Both cameras are rated very well in this area.  I haven't "tested" them, but it seems like the Panasonic is built a bit tougher and would be less likely to get destroyed in a fall.  Rather than test this feature, I'm going to just trust the experts that either one will hold up well if dropped.UPDATE:  I also posted this review on another site and I recently added photos to it.  Seeing is believing!  [...]

Reviews.Title: Buyers Regret!!!
Reviews.Author: Lannyb40
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with the hope that it would be able to keep up with my active lifestyle. When I received this product, I was anxious to see how it would hold up. I charged the battery and placed it in its protective slot, I was off to put it to the test. I wanted to try it in the pool before I used it at the lake or on our upcoming caribbean cruise. I switched it to underwater mode and it told me to check that all the openings were closed and sealed. I checked the openings and in the pool I went. (3 feet deep at the deepest) Needless to say it crashed and burned on its maiden voyage. The screen started to flicker and after about a minute of being scrambled, it died! Never to work again. Like others that have had issues with this camera and the Sony "customer care" Sony refuses to replace let alone refund my money due to water damage. I wouldn't have a problem with that if it was my fault that the camera malfunctioned. My experience with this camera and Sony leaves a bad taste in my mouth. GO AHEAD AND PASS ON THIS PRODUCT, IT WILL SAVE YOU TIME AND MONEY.HUGE LET DOWN SONY!!!

Reviews.Title: Works fantastic!!!
Reviews.Author: Tarsier14
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Sony Cyber-shot camera, pricey but worth the investment. I just purchased DSC-HX5VB when i went on vacation on March of this year , it's a good camera but when i saw this DSC-TX10 @ Amazon & said will be available by April, I couldn't wait to get one. This is the best one! Everything about this camera has floored me, the video quality is even better. I'm not a pro but my friends were so amazed w/ the quality of pictures, it's no brainer, just shoot & the camera does a great job! I would recommend this camera to anyone, well worth the money spent. I got a carrying case to protect my investment. Thank you Sony, I am very pleased, well done!!! Thanks to you too, Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera in a small package.  I bought this camera about a month ago and just got back from Florida, Walt Disney World, Universal and Discovery Cove.  It took great pictures of the fireworks, great night pictures, awesome day pictures of the park, the castle, family, the Disney characters.  I took this to Discovery cove and in the salt and non-salt water with me.  I took over 150 underwater pictures and movies and it worked great.  You MUST follow the directions, after in salt water, let it soak in non-salt water for a minute or so.  Then dry off immediately.  It still works today great!

Reviews.Title: Camera body breaks without neglect
Reviews.Author: Kodachrome11 "kodachrome11"
Reviews.Content: I was reasonably happy with this camera even though the image quality was poor and the touchscreen did not work as it should, the camera was purchased for its waterproof capabilities and it served its purpose for a while.  It was not heavily used when the 1 year warranty expired and a week later a piece broke off of the lower right corner of the body. It was an unprovoked and not neglected. I did some research and this happens frequently with this camera. After sending it into the company they said that it would be a $250 repair, that they couldn't just replace that one piece, it had to be a full repair (meaning that every little time I scratched it, they used it against me).  I had heard horror stories about the company and customer service, but we remained loyal customers, until today.  I am extremely disappointed, and regret the day I made this purchase.  I wish I could say otherwise, but the camera and the company is a bad choice. Stay away.A few reviewers with the same problem.[...][...]

Reviews.Title: too slow, too inaccurate, and too gimmicky
Reviews.Author: Shiba
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera along with me on my trip to Central America to snap pictures in situations where I do not want to bring my D300.  I was attracted by its compactness, lens, and touch screen.The pictures this camera took was pure crap.  During my trip, there was nothing but sunshine with little cloud coverage.  The pics taken on intelligent mode were overblown and could not be fixed.  It absolutely refuses to dial down the exposure on its own.  The metering on this camera is awful and white balance was all over the place.  I was in both the jungle and the beaches and had to put the camera in Program mode and manually adjust the settings in order to take any decent photos.  However its low light performance is superb and underwater photographs were crisp.  The layout is intuitive, but the preview button is in an awkward position.The camera takes 7 seconds from turning on till its ready to shoot.  Way too long as compared to its competitors.  Its sliding door is finicky at times and will require both hands to slide down.  The touch screen is nice, but it is unusable underwater.  It also gets covered with fingerprints over the course of the day and does not make for a pleasant viewing area for your photos.I also had the cracking issue on the upper and lower right side of the camera, by the power button.  The camera was not dropped in any shape or form so I was quite surprised by it.  As such I could not use it for underwater photos anymore.I actually liked the phone in green because it stands out quite a bit.  You cannot miss spotting the camera wherever its lying.  Some might say that will attract thieves, but I think it might deter them.  Who's going to steal a day glow green camera and think they can get away with it?This camera sets high expectations and fails in most categories.  I like the design and layout, but as a camera, it was just useless.  Its just too slow, too inaccurate, and too gimmicky to compete in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Great idea but not up to claims by Sony
Reviews.Author: Ron Paul for press!
Reviews.Content: Love the idea of this small waterproof camera BUT after taking it into the ocean and shooting pictures and videos something happened. The videos have pixel issues that go unnoticed on the small LCD of the camera but are devastating on my monitor. Some of the pictures have strange lines at the bottom. I'm bummed cause some great videos and pictures are junk now. I'm returning it and won't buy this camera again. Also will question sonys statements in the future about there products. On the positive note it works with sd cards.

Reviews.Title: Sony - No Baloney
Reviews.Author: J. Preston
Reviews.Content: I was originally going to give this camera four stars.  However, after I used it for a couple of months, and, got used to its features, I decided that five stars was more appropriate.My first "point and shoot" is an ancient SONY DSC T33 (5.1 Mp) Sony Cybershot DSCT33 5.1MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Includes Docking Station) I bought about five years ago.  It is a little beat up, but, it has worked really well, and, continues to work really well.  I love it.  I wouldn't have bought a new camera except I misplaced it for a few months and needed a new one.This camera DSC-TX10, provides three times the resolution, and I am really happy with the higher resolution.  It's hard to take a bad picture because, with the high resolution, you can electronically crop most photos into award-winning pictures, and the remaining cropped image still has plenty of resolution.This is a camera you can stick in your pocket, and, take with you, all the time.  It is compact, lightweight, sturdy enough to take jolts, bumps and an occasional fall.  You can keep it in "easy mode" for almost instant "point and shoots", and, it will stay in easy mode until you exit into the more complicated functions.  I cherish the simplicity.  I have 22 years of education, and, many years of technical experience.  I am no "technophobe".  However, as I mature, I find my life bleeding away and I don't want to spend it buried in technical manuals for gadgest that are supposed to be enhancing my life, and, giving me more time for important things.This camera does the job.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: juspain
Reviews.Content: I read lots of reviews on this camera before buying it, and half of them scared the hell out of me thinking that this waterproof camera wasn't going to be able to hack my vacation to the Caribbean.Those other peeps must have had a lot of misfortune, cause I used it exactly like the instructions say, and needless to say, I still have a full functioning waterproof camera after swimming around in the Caribbean and island hoping for 10 days.I liked all the features on this camera more than the others out there, so that is why I bought it.I swam around with this camera in my pocket, took lots of underwater pics and videos. My pictures turned out amazing, and everyone in my group was super jealous of my sleek looking camera, and the waterproof-ability of it.Never had a single problem with it.My only complaint about this camera is that the functions are way slow compared to other cameras. Takes forever to play back pics, flip through them, begin video recording. That sort of thing. Overall im pleased with it though, and look forward to using it again.

Reviews.Title: Love the looks
Reviews.Author: Hao C. Quach
Reviews.Content: Always wanted to purchase this camera, so on Black Friday, saw it on Amazon for $169.00 & grabbed it.  I see there are a lot of people complaining the camera is not waterproof.  So I decided to test out the waterproof effectiveness before my 30 day return policy ended.  I filled my bathtub full of water, took pictures underwater & left it there for two hours.  The pictures came out perfect & my camera was still working after submerging it for 2 hours.  Maybe the camera might act differently out in the real world, buy under control situation, it worked fine.  But overall the camera was great, except for the screen is kinda small, the battery life sucks & the touch screen will not work when wet.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-TX10
Reviews.Author: Merlin
Reviews.Content: Camera is great we are having a blast with this thing.  We take it swimming and havn't had any problems with taking it in the water.  Pictures are clear and look great on a large screen.  It's easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Fun water camera
Reviews.Author: veronica mendes
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for water sports or activities! The only problem is that once not using it in the water, there are water spots on the lens, which come through in all my average pics. I had bought this to be an all purpose everyday pocket camera, but unfortunately it just became an expensive water camera. I love the panoramic feature, but can't find any place by me that is capable of printing such sizes, so have to have them special ordered online. The video camera works well but it is a little tricky as it does not start or start exactly when you push the button, so if you are trying to tape something on the spur, that is impossible!! All in all I really am happy to have an underwater camera, but paying maybe about half this much would have made it better.

Reviews.Title: Ugh, it lasted 2 days.... DO NOT BUY IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Renato Sampaio
Reviews.Content: I bought the Sony TX10 for my Tahiti trip. The quality os the photos weren't great. Most images were dull and desaturated. Lacked color and contrast. My previous DSC-N1 (2005) produced better results. But here's the worst part: the camera died the second time I used it in the water while snorkeling. I didn't lose the pictures I had already taken up to that point, but had no camera for the rest of the trip...  Sony won't refund my money or fix the camera because water damaged it.... Isn't that why we buy a waterproof camera????

Reviews.Title: Camera is yellow, not green
Reviews.Author: Mart
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why they call this camera green. There is a little bit of green on the back but it is more yellow.So far enjoying it. Takes great pictures.The menu is going to take practice to get used to. But this camera does so much it's expected.Overall very happy with it :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Nelson Zambrano
Reviews.Content: A great camera, just what you expected from what you can see in the pictures, worth the money for the good quality

Reviews.Title: Controls too small and lens in bad position
Reviews.Author: Gene Walshaw
Reviews.Content: This camera has small control buttons even for my small fingers. Having many of option controls on the screen causers constant screen cleaning. Even worse is the position of the lens. Due to its overall small size, it was difficult to get all fingers away from the lens. Many shots had fingertips showing. It is smaller than most smart phones so a cell phone with a good camera is a better choice. Picture quality is average. I sent it back for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Pics!
Reviews.Author: Frances
Reviews.Content: I have own this camera for 2 years and it takes beautiful brigth pics! I always get compliment on the pics.  I have used it under water many times (salt water and regular water).  The quality it's amazing! It has many features, great product, great price!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Reviewer2012
Reviews.Content: Compact, good specs, easy to carry, diverse shooting capabilities, one of the best point and shoot that i have owned.

Reviews.Title: camara sensacional
Reviews.Author: Luisito
Reviews.Content: es un producto excelente de altisima calidad. funciona perfectamente y ha cumplido con las expectativas. Lo recomiendo plenamente. es una de las mejores camaras de bolsillo

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera actually is waterproof!
Reviews.Author: Magnolia Studios
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera actually is waterproof!I'm not into pocket point and shoots but this camera takes great pics. Even Underwater.  Video is way better than expected. Compares to my Panasonic GH2 and Canon 60D.

Reviews.Title: Tested to the Extreme
Reviews.Author: Alaska Girl
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as an alternative to my $8000 DSLR when on vacation somewhere I didn't want to lug a lot of photography gear.  There are plenty of reviews here with highly technical info, so I'll cover the basic pros and cons from my own experience.  After owning it over a year I have a pretty good handle on what I do, and don't like.Pros*It's uber small, I can easily fit it in my pocket/purse/hand ect and it basically disappears.  As a result I find myself taking it a lot of places I wouldn't take even a slightly larger camera*Battery life is pretty decent, especially with non-Canon brand replacements it seems. I live in the extreme arctic, and keeping my camera warm is imperative, at -50 your batteries die mighty quick, so the size is even more important to me. With zero battery conservation I can easily go on one battery for a day, I always take a spare, but rarely need it, and I take a lot of pictures (750 a day?)*I have tested the waterproof capabilities and they seem great to me.  I've followed to the letter the post submerged instructions and have never had any issues with leaks.  I think it's IMPERATIVE people follow these instructions, especially when it's been in salt water.*Picture Quality: Phenomenal, low light is great, the sweep panorama is nothing less than totally awesome.  Now granted, my expensive DSLR will obviously take higher quality pictures, but for a P&S; waterproof camera....it doesn't get much better. I have been nothing short of highly impressed with the quality.Cons*Sometimes the touch screen has a life of it's own, it will be unresponsive sometimes, and to responsive others.  If I don't pay attention and it's on in my pocket I'll have "touched" my way to some random screen before I know what's going on.  On other times (it seems especially prevalent when trying to switch to playback mode) the icon won't respond.  I'll have to turn the camera on and back on again for it to work.*About 6 months into owning it the plastic housing around the touch screen started to crack out on the corners. I did NOT drop the camera or mis-handle it in any way.  After reading some online forums I found this was a semi-common problem although Canon hadn't issued a recall for it.  I sent the unit in for warranty work, and I prepared myself for a fight since I'd heard nightmare stories about warranty repair.  To my pleasant surprise I recd the unit back, fully repaired, and no cost, in less than a week with no questions asked.*It is annoying Canon doesn't ship an external charging unit with this camera.  Without purchasing it seperate you're forced to charge your battery in camera, rendering it unavailable during this time.  Since sooner or later every user will need an external charger I would think they would up the price by $10 and include on.  That being said, you can easily purchase one, for cheap.Overall I've been very satisfied with this camera.  It's not perfect, but I would purchase it again.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE CAMERA; HORRIBLE SUPPORT
Reviews.Author: Ping Porsche
Reviews.Content: WHY CAN'T I GIVE NEGATIVE STARS?DON'T BUY THIS OR ANY OTHER SONY CAMERA!!!!!Sony makes crap cameras and their support will accuse you of breaking it.Purchase from a respectable camera maker like Canon, Nikon, or Fuji.I bought this for snorkeling and it corrupted my memory card on the first trip.OK, $10,000 trip with no pictures, because the camera corrupted the memory.Called Sony and they blamed the memory.Got two new memory cards for the next trip.OK, new trip, $5k trip with no pictures because the entire stupid camera craps out.Called Sony, no apologies, no emergency loaner, just a send it in with the receipt so we can verify it's still under warranty.Sent the camera in to the depot, on my own dime.They call and accused me of opening the camera door.What idiots! Why the hell would I do that? So I can ruin my pictures?  TWICE????!!!!!I contacted all the way up to national customer support.All idiots along the way.They didn't do a user test underwater.They just dunk it and say it's still WATER-RESISTANT, so it must be user error.F#$% OFF SONY!!!!Whatever you do, buy something else and save your money, this is a horrible product, that takes horrible pictures and is slow as mud, with a horrible touchscreen that doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: excelente camara
Reviews.Author: joeccs
Reviews.Content: 100% recomendada ya tengo mas de un año con ella, y aunque no soy un fotografo profesional pero si un aficionado, me ha encantadoLa bateria dura muchisimo, al menos un dia entero de uso. La calidad de fotos es muy buena, las imagenes 3D y panoramicas son un plus, los videos en hd muy buenosLa he usado varias veces debajo del agua y simplemente la secoRecomiendo comprarle una memoria de al menos 8GB ya que pesan mucho sus archivos, yo tengo de 16GB100% recommended I have more than a year with it, and although I am not a professional photographer but an amateur, I lovedThe battery lasts a lot, at least one full day of use. The photo quality is very good, the 3D and panoramic images are a plus, good HD videosI've used it several times under water and just dry the cameraI recommend buying a memory of at least 8GB because the files are very heavy, I have one of 16GB

Reviews.Title: Waterproof cameras should not drown.
Reviews.Author: M. Chessher "MC TX"
Reviews.Content: Well the camera was good, but I could have gotten a much cheaper "good" camera - I bought this one because of the Sony name and the waterproofing.  Well, the waterproofing failed and the camera stopped working after only a few uses.  I sent it back and Sony refused to replace it stating that water got in it.Do not buy this product unless you want to be out some $300 pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: My favorite Digital Camera Ever
Reviews.Author: stevec
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to bring on my honeymoon, I couldn't be more happy.  I am a very experienced digital camera owner/user and have some D SLR's.  I bought this camera because it is so incredibly small and didn't want to bring all the rest of my DSLR gear on my trip.  I also wanted a camera that was so easy to use we could hand it to someone on the street to take our picture (this was very important).My favorite feature is the sweep panoramic, this is the reason I went with sony as opposed to some of the other brands and will continue to stick with them.The only downside that I have seen so far is that because the camera is all touchscreen on the back, it is very hard to change any of the settings underwater (besides the zoom).

Reviews.Title: For underwater and great panoramas, but very slow.
Reviews.Author: Jorge
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the only purpose of having a camera that I could take with me all day long and use it everywhere, even at the beach or underwater and create amazing panoramic shoots.I'm an amateur photographer and I use my Nikon D90 camera for taking pictures, most of them in manual mode.I knew I would never be able to shoot the pictures that I shoot with my D90 with this small Sony cam, but I bought it to have it with me all day long  (and by "all day long" I mean everywhere, 24/7). The D90 can sometimes be a little bit too big to be carrying it when in parties or concerts, or too risky to bring it to the beach.It's a VERY automatic camera (which I sometimes hate), flash is unbeliavably bright (it's either off or auto... it has a slow-sync but only in certain scene automatic modes), and it's incredibly slow when using the auto+ (or superior auto+) feature which takes a burst of pictures and overlay the best exposed parts all into one pic.. The exposure sometimes is great, but in the process of doing this, it takes a lot of time.If you're looking for a small, automatic, underwater and panorama shooting camera (panoramas are AMAZING by the way), this is your camera.If you want to get creative with your pictures, don't buy it.And it's YELLOW, not green.

Reviews.Title: need answer ASAP
Reviews.Author: kelly
Reviews.Content: Hi, I`m thinking about buying this, but I`m wondering if you can take pictures while shooting a video. Another Cyber Shot has that feature but I would prefer to have the waterproof version since we are about to leave for the beach (and our 6yrs old Sony just died!) Anybody can answer that???? Thank you so much for your help!!

Reviews.Title: Happy investment
Reviews.Author: Haynecort
Reviews.Content: This camera was beyond expectation, took it to ride water rides and slides in theme parks and water parks, and now we have priceless photos of our fun time together. Easy to use, clear hd videos, lived up to being waterproof, small handy and cute, and at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Too slooooow
Reviews.Author: OP
Reviews.Content: It is just too sloooow and non-practical to take pictures, videos or play it back. At the store said the memory need to be fast "special", so I got the expensive memory and no change. The camera is just unusable. I will returned to the store or to Sony and get my money back.

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: Gcarvalho
Reviews.Content: great camera! shooting and shooting in HD even under water! easy to handle, large display and good resolution. Small to carry in the pocket!

Reviews.Title: Love it, but...
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Robadey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera during a trip to NYC. I took more than 1 thousand pics, and they all look AMAZING in it's screen, I was so happy with it. By the time I got back home, I was eager to see the pics in the computer screen, thinking they must look even better there. but that it not what happened. The pictures look kind of dull, with a lot less contrast and definition than they looked in the camera screen... =/

Reviews.Title: TX10--great pocketable camera!
Reviews.Author: pneuss
Reviews.Content: Really enjoy using this camera. It easily fits in a pocket and I take it everywhere. It takes pretty good low light pics (HandHeld Twilight and AntiMotion Blur are amazing). Also have fun with the panorama scene mode. It takes very good pictures in good light and has lots of flexibility with various manual settings like white balance, exposure adjustment, etc... Water proof, shock proof, and freeze proof...I absolutely love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber Shot
Reviews.Author: Lara M
Reviews.Content: My son saved up and bought this camera.  He LOVES it.  He loves to videotape stuff, and constantly has it on him.  Super buy.  Just wish we would have waited a few more months before we bought it. The price went down a lot... Oh well.  He has had it over 5 months, and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Nice, but problem with battery
Reviews.Author: Lighthouse
Reviews.Content: Its a very nice camera, picture quality is very good, touch screen is good. But the battery life is too bad. It does not continue even for 30 pics. If the battery is kept in the camera for 3/4 days, the battery got dead.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Arun Ranganathan
Reviews.Content: I ordered the product on Thanks giving day. It is an excellent product. I dropped my camera twice. But it works so well and has only some very few scratches. It is water resistant and I tested under water in a swimming pool and the picture quality is still very good. An excellent product for the price. Can offer more for this product because of the quality of the image as well as the product itself.

Reviews.Title: fantastic
Reviews.Author: Ivana Babkova
Reviews.Content: I love how compact and easy to use this camera is. The touch screen works great, and the built-in User Guide is very easy to access and understand. Now I just need to test how it works under water...

Reviews.Title: Best Waterproof Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: HIchris808
Reviews.Content: The pictures are great on this camera. The video is so clear, full HD. This is waterproof, I don't know what this other people are writing that it is not. I took it in pools and oceans and it still works. It been in snow and wet snowboarding days. It IS waterproof. You just have to take care of it. If you're dunking it in water, salt or chlorine especially, clean it after. I'm betting these people that say its not waterproof as just not doing a good job of maintenance.Overall, this camera is awesome. I would go as far as saying its the best out there, as far as pocket cameras go.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie M Peters
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter who just moved to the Caribbean.  She loves this camera and is thrilled with the underwater feature as well as the 3D sweep panorama.  She has found this camera to be everything described and more.  Great camera with great features. I'm going to purchase one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly good.. I mean, REALLY GOOD!!!
Reviews.Author: Katerina Lusterio "KLusterio"
Reviews.Content: This camera  was surprisingly really good, given the price and size of the camera.  What surprised me most is the picture quality which clearly surpassed the ones from my Nikon Coolpix S9100.  I bought the Sony camera mainly for its waterproofness but now I think it will be my default camera unless I need a longer zoom which is now the only feature I'd still need from the Nikon.  The auto mode really works on the Sony whereas it was hit and miss on the Nikon.Updated on July 4 2012:  This camera does excellent under water.  Sound and picture exceed my expectations.  My friends are impressed, and they want to buy one like this.  I bought mine from one of those Amazon 1 day deals for less than 200 dollars.  I see that it is now (July 4 2012) selling for $399!  Wow!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: F. Diaz
Reviews.Content: I'm not a camera aficionado, or very good at reviews I guess, so I don't have a pros and cons list but I really like this camera. I can't speak to the waterproof-ness of it because I haven't used it in the water yet but I can say it has plenty of picture settings, the images come out clean and sharp and I had fun playing with the panoramic shots. It feels solid but not heavy, it's slim but not tiny, for a non-SLR camera I'd say it's a great machine. This is our second Sony Cyber-Shot camera and our first waterproof camera. My sister liked the quality of pictures so much that she bought one also. Even though my review isn't very technical I hope it helps.

Reviews.Title: great picture quality
Reviews.Author: bella6164
Reviews.Content: Got this for my husband for Christmas and he loves it! Read all the reviews before ordering this item they were all so helpful in making this superior product our number one choice.

Reviews.Title: New Sony Compact
Reviews.Author: Chris Day
Reviews.Content: Exactly what was expected - an excellent camera. Great touch screen, compact and great results. The waterproof and dust proof fraetures were a big benefit for beach use

Reviews.Title: very good camera model
Reviews.Author: Mariana
Reviews.Content: very good camera model because it includes the best features of the Sony cameras in a compact, comfortable and easy to carry, has very good resolution and the images are sharp

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife who insisted she wanted a sony waterproof camera. I had already bought her a fujifilm waterproof camera but she did not like the quality of the pictures it took. The sony pictures were very good and i was impressed with its quality. I will definiently tell everyone that this is a great camera and should be the first one they should look at before others.

Reviews.Title: The best camera
Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera, it has everything that i was looking for...best sound on videos, 3d photos, and excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: Nice quality camera
Reviews.Author: H. White
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera and so far it is far better than expected.  I give 4 stars only because I have not yet tried the waterproof function.  The video is incredibly sharp, great sound and has the option of taking stills while recording.  Easy to use touch screen (which can also be "locked" so you don't accidentally change settings).  Camera quickly starts up when you slide open the front cover, no need to press on button.  The menus and many different scene selections are very simple to use and understand with a built in instruction manual in the menu as well.  I did put a cell phone screen protector on the touch screen to protect it from scratches etc.  This camera is also fantastic in low light conditions.  My last camera was very poor in low light so this really stands out for me.  As for waterproofing, there are rubber gaskets on the two covers that open.  The buttons to open these are small and recessed so I don't think they would accidentally be opened underwater unless they had not been closed tightly to begin with.  I used it yesterday in conditions below freezing and it performed well, battery life was good and the pictures turned out great.  Great little camera (about the size of a credit card)!

Reviews.Title: I can tell, I'm going to love this
Reviews.Author: V. Schmidt "blue9112"
Reviews.Content: It just arrived yesterday, and I have already taken lots of pics with it, including night shots (no wet, yet) and posted some on redbubble dot com (slash people slash cricket noel) and have received good feedback on the orchid shots. I did not really need a new camera, but this was a Deal of the Day and I could not resist. It is small and easy to use ... although I am still learning all of its tricks ...  I can tell it's going to be a lot of fun. Will have to look up the user manual online, though, because the flimsy, tiny print multi-language booklet that comes in the box is hard to read, hence 4 stars instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: Primarily for special needs
Reviews.Author: W. Wedenoja
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for one major purpose - to take pictures for research in a boat at sea - but I thought it would also be useful for rugged outdoor use in general, particularly hiking and field archaeology. It is water-resistant but after reading a number of reviews I didn't have enough confidence to take it into the ocean, particularly as it would be a hassle to clean off the salt water according to directions. Still, it was nice to know that it would probably survive splashes and even rain. It is also supposedly rugged, and it will get kicked around in a boat, or on a trail, or at an archaeological site. And probably relatively dust-proof as well. One major liability is that I found it almost impossible to see anything in the screen in bright sunlight (unlike my Canon S95). I just had to point in the general direction and hope for the best. Another big problem is that the lens is at the top right corner. I naturally put my left hand there and often got a piece of finger in the corner of my pictures. The camera is small and light and has virtually no protuberances, making it slick to hold but also easy to slide into a front pants pocket. The touchscreen interface is simple to learn and use, but sketchy to the touch - sometimes too sensitive, other times not enough. Finally, indoor shots are nowhere near as good as my Canon S95. I should add that the color of the body is unique and difficult to like. If you are looking for a good point-and-shoot then this is overpriced. Get it only if you need something rugged - water-resistant, dust-proof, and impact-resistant - and won't be using it in bright sun.

Reviews.Title: For the money - superstar beach camera
Reviews.Author: P. Welsh "Objective Consumer"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a camera to catch what you've always missed at the beach - because you feared you'd damage your 'good camera'... you need this one.We spent 2 weeks at the beach and took more than 3,000 photos (burst mode ensured we didn't miss a thing - but spent a lot of time deleting dupes).It's instant video mode is fantastic and the quality is perfect for the money.Well done Sony, my loyalty is again - well placed!

Reviews.Title: Wow Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Speck
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on vacation and it was amazing.  The photos are the best underwater pictures I have every taken.  This camera goes from water to dry so quickly and easy.  Sony has truly designed a great camera for taking you to the best places to take water pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for beginnes as well!
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: This camera has proven to work extremely well in many light conditions, or lack of, even in the hands of inexperienced shooters. We still didn't have tha chance to test it underwater, but that looks promising.The touch panel is quite a pain, but you can get used to it. Overall a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: TNIU Student
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good for a point and shoot... fun features, but has a good auto mode to just pick up and go with it... The panoramic sweep is fun!  Used it underwater right away... The underwater pics came out great (using the underwater shooting mode).

Reviews.Title: sony cyber
Reviews.Author: karen
Reviews.Content: The camera takes awesome pictures in a quick snap. Underwater shots are clear with great resolution. I love my camera, worth the price.

Reviews.Title: I loveee this camera
Reviews.Author: Dianap
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best camera ever!!!!!The batery duration is amazin... many hours in operation and standby. Excelent quallity of images and videos (HD). sweep panorama is a really good tool, but the best is the underwater pictures, extremly awesome!100% recommended

Reviews.Title: could be better
Reviews.Author: Paula Amarante
Reviews.Content: The camera has everything to be a very good camera but there is still a few things that its horrible.The camera is very cute, nice colors, nice futures, small. BUT, one off the worst thing is the touch screen is very sensitive, when you hold the camera to shoot the pictures you fingers touch by accident every time on the screen and mess is up everything, press places that you don't want, because the back off the camera has no space for you to hold on without touching the screen. Plus battery life is very short, and the camera is soooooo slow that makes anyone very angry. And the record button is so small and you have to press the soooo hard to start recording and take a while to start. who doesn't have a long nail can not press this tinny button. And one more thing, to press the button to playback and view your pictures it says accessing and take forever.So the rest is good, kkkkkkkkI did return my camera and i don't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: heislem
Reviews.Content: Excelent equipment, very good... is the major camera that I have now because I am very meticuloso to search my cameras...

Reviews.Title: Sony, Sony, Sony, what's going on with you!
Reviews.Author: Stephen B. Daniels "curly"
Reviews.Content: If your looking to buy a Sony digital camera of late, have you ever wondered why people have a red tint to them when you look at the LCD screen?  Every model that I have looked at from the cheapest to a $1,000 slr manufactured by Sony people have a red tint to the skin tones.  When you snap the picture and look at your new photo on the camera, people still have a red tint.  Here's the kicker, when you download the photo and view them on a computer they look great, no more red tint.  I have a 5 years old Sony DSC-W100 that takes great pictures and what I see on the LCD monitor is the same picture I see after I snap the picture and after I download it to the computer.  I don't know what's going on with Sony but this is totally unacceptable.  When I take the picture I don't know if what I just took is a bad pic or what.  This TX10 is no different and that's why I sent it back.  If it weren't for this HUGE problem I would have kept the camera but I can't deal with the "red tint" problem.  Oh yeah, one other thing, I posted a picture of what this camera really looks like.  From the photo on Amazon it look pretty yellow to me but it's not and it's not green but an iridescent mix of green/yellow, kinda ugly to me.  Oh, one other thing the camera that I used to take the "real" picture of the TX10 was taken by my Sony DSC-W100.  Sony can't even get the colors of there own camera's correct, I guess their using Sony camera's to take pictures of their Sony camera's.

Reviews.Title: Poor support, from India during business hours.
Reviews.Author: Emily Railey "Emily Railey"
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to finally get a nice Mega Pixel camera, to only be disappointed and aggravated with the lack of quality and support. My daughter and I both have blonde hair and every time either of us were photographed with this camera our hair in the pics was red. Tried troubleshooting the white balance with no luck. Then went to esupport.sony.com and the chat person terminated my talk before it began. So called customer service which was obviously in India, and I had to repeat myself 5 times and wait on hold for 2 hours for them to finally advise me not to use the flash. Why would we pay two hundred dollars for a camera that you can not use the flash? Needless to say I returned to Amazon. This is the fourth defective product we have bought from Amazon!Nevermind!When uploaded all pics to computer they were blonde, just look red on camera :)Still unhappy with service of Sony.

Reviews.Title: This camaera is not Compatible with Sony MPKTHJ DSC Marine Pack
Reviews.Author: Manoel Cifuentes
Reviews.Content: I own both the Sony MPKTHJ DSC Marine Pack and Sony DSC-TX10 and THEY DON'T WORK TOGETHER FOR SURE y also have DSC-TX5 and this one really works with this marine pack.

ProductInfo.Features:
Certified waterproof, dustproof, shockproof and freeze-proof
3.0 Touch screen for easy focus selection and photo viewing
Full HD 1080/60i with dual record of stills and movies
16.2MP Exmor R CMOS sensor for stunning low-light performance
3D still image and 3D Sweep Panorama:  change the view of the world
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Cyber-Shot DSC-TX10 16.2 MP Waterproof Digital Still Camera with Exmor R CMOS Sensor, 3D Sweep Panorama, and Full HD 1080/60i Video (Green)
